hypothesis_content.title: Low-Volume Pre-Weekend Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a strong (>1.2%), low-volume (< 80% of 20-day average) price move occurring between 12:00-18:00 UTC on a Friday will fade by >50% before the weekly close (Sunday 23:59 UTC), as momentum chasers lack weekend liquidity to sustain the move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-volume moves are prone to slippage and manipulation. A strong move late on a Friday, when liquidity naturally drains for the weekend, is particularly suspect. In a neutral regime lacking a strong directional catalyst, the move is likely driven by isolated large orders or short-term momentum algorithms that will be unable to maintain position over the illiquid weekend, leading to a fade.
entry_conditions: Volume during that 1-hour candle is < 80% of its 20-day average for the same hourly period
Entry on the close of the triggering 1-hour candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 65% of the initial 1-hour move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends a further 0.8% in the direction of the initial move

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Low-volume Friday spikes in neutral regimes are sustained (>50% held) through the weekly close more than 45% of the time, indicating they reflect genuine positioning rather than illiquid noise.
